data.title: A-Listers Scheduled to Appear at TIFF 15
data.meta_description: Find out where Hollywood’s biggest names are scheduled to appear during TIFF 2015.
data.text:
August 26, 2015 – The Toronto International Film Festival is almost here, scheduled to run September 10-20.

This year marks TIFF’s fortieth anniversary. They are kicking off the festival in style with a charity bash on September 9th featuring Academy Award winner Natalie Portman. Tickets are still available.

For all you star-gazers out there, we have compiled a list of film premieres featuring the biggest names coming to Toronto. Once you make your pics, visit the TIFF website at 9 AM sharp on September 6th to buy single tickets. They sell out fast!

Thursday September 10

Roy Thomson Hall

Demolition – 8:00pm (Jake Gyllenhaal, Naomi Watts, Chris Cooper, Judah Lewis)

Elgin/Winter Theatre

A Tale of Love and Darkness – 7:00pm (Directed and starred Natalie Portman, Gilad Kahana, Amir Tessler)

London Road – 9:30pm (Olivia Colman, Anita Dobson, Tom Hardy)

Friday September 11

Roy Thomson Hall

Eye in the Sky – 6:30pm (Helen Mirren, Aaron Paul, Alan Rickman, Barkhad

The Martian – 9:30pm (Matt Damon, Jessica Chastain, Kristen Wiig, Jeff Daniels, Michael Peña, Sean Bean, Kate Mara, Sebastian Stan, Aksel Hennie, Chiwetel Ejiofor, Benedict Wong, Mackenzie Davis, Donald Glover)

Princess of Wales

Lobster – 3:00pm (Colin Farrell, Rachel Weisz, John C. Reilly, Léa Seydoux, Ben Whishaw)

Our Brand is Crisis – 6:30pm (Sandra Bullock, Billy Bob Thornton, Anthony Mackie, Joaquim de Almeida, Ann Dowd, Scoot McNairy, Zoe Kazan, Dominic Flores)

Sicario – 10:00pm (Emily Blunt, Benicio Del Toro, Josh Brolin, Jon Berthal, Victor Garber, Daniel Kaluuya)

Ryerson

I Saw The Light – 6:00pm (Elizabeth Olsen, Tom Hiddleston, Bradley Whitford, David Krumholtz, Cherry Jones)

TIFF Bell Lightbox

Every Thing Will Be Fine – 7:30pm (James Franco, Charlotte Gainsbourg, Rachel McAdams, Marie-Josée Croze, Robert Naylor, Patrick Bauchau, Peter Stormare)

Roy Thomson Hall

Princess of Wales

About Ray – 3:00pm (Naomi Watts, Elle Fanning, Susan Sarandon, Tate Donovan, Linda Emond, Sam Trammell, Maria Dizzia)

Danish Girl – 6:15pm (Eddie Redmayne, Alicia Vikander, Ben Whishaw, Sebastian Koch, Amber Heard, Matthias Schoenaerts)

Maggie’s Plan – 9:30pm (Greta Gerwig, Ethan Hawke, Bill Hader, Maya Rudolph, Travis Fimmel, Ida Rohatyn, Wallace Shawn, Julianne Moore)

Elgin/Winter Theatre

TIFF Bell Lightbox

Scotiabank

Your Friends – 9:00pm (Nicholas Hoult, James Corden, Georgia King, Craig Roberts, Tom Riley, Joseph Mawle, Edward Hogg, Ed Skrein, Moritz Bleibtreu, Rosanna Arquette)

Ryerson Theatre
